meanings.definition: A standard of perfection or excellence.
meanings.sent1: Her painting was the ideal of beauty and grace.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's idea of an ideal student is someone who is respectful and hardworking.
meanings.sent3: In a world where everyone is unique, striving for an ideal can be quite challenging.
meanings.sent4: The ideal of a perfect society is often just a dream.
meanings.sent5: The ideal of justice should be upheld in all circumstances.

meanings.definition: A person or thing regarded as perfect or most suitable.
meanings.sent1: To her, he was the ideal of a loving partner.
meanings.sent2: The new car model was the ideal for families with young children.
meanings.sent3: Finding the ideal gift for her friend's birthday was a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: She was the ideal of elegance and sophistication at the party.
meanings.sent5: The ideal of a perfect vacation spot is different for everyone.

meanings.definition: Existing only in the imagination; not real.
meanings.sent1: The unicorn was an ideal creature in the fairy tale.
meanings.sent2: The idea of a flying car is ideal but not yet a reality.
meanings.sent3: His ideal plan for the weekend involved traveling to Mars.
meanings.sent4: The ideal world in his mind was full of rainbows and unicorns.
meanings.sent5: The ideal solution to the problem seemed too good to be true.
